Class Tweet

The Tweet class represents a tweet with an associated photo, caption, date, and likes. The class provides methods to retrieve and manipulate the tweet information, including resizing the photo and generating a formatted string representation of the tweet.

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type
    Field
    Description
    static final int
    PHOTO_SIZE
    The desired size for the resized photo. You may change this value to whatever you would like to resize the photo!

    Constructs a new Tweet with specified photo, caption, date, likes, and retweets.

  • Field Details

    • PHOTO_SIZE

      public static final int PHOTO_SIZE
      The desired size for the resized photo. You may change this value as you see fit to resize the photo!
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

  • Constructor Details

    • Tweet

      public Tweet(String photoString, String caption, String date, int likes, int retweets)
      Constructs a new Tweet with specified photo, caption, date, likes, and retweets.
      Example Usage: 
      Tweet tweet = new Tweet("gumball/flowers.png", "Gumball with flowers!", "2024-01-22", 250, 40);
      Parameters:
      photoString - The file path of the photo
      caption - The caption of the tweet
      date - The date of the tweet
      likes - The number of likes on the tweet
      retweets - The number of retweets on the tweet
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If retweets are less than 0 or photo dimensions are smaller than PHOTO_SIZE

    • Tweet

      public Tweet(String photoString, String caption, String date)
      Constructs a new Tweet with a specified photo, caption, and date where it automatically assigns random values for likes and retweets.
      Example Usage: 
      Tweet tweet = new Tweet("gumball/flowers.png", "Gumball with flowers!", "2024-01-22");
      Parameters:
      photoString - The file path of the photo
      caption - The caption of the tweet
      date - The date of the tweet
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If photo dimensions are smaller than PHOTO_SIZE

  • Method Details

    • getPhotoString

      public String getPhotoString()
      Returns the string representation of the resized photo.
      Example usage: 
      Tweet tweet = new Tweet("gumball/flowers.png", "Gumball with flowers!", "2024-01-22", 250, 40);
System.out.println(tweet.getPhotoString()); // Output will be the color string representation of the photo.
      Returns:
      The string representation of the resized photo

    • getFilename

      public String getFilename()
      Returns the filename of the photo associated with this tweet.
      Example usage: 
      Tweet tweet = new Tweet("gumball/flowers.png", "Gumball with flowers!", "2024-01-22", 250, 40);
System.out.println(tweet.getFilename()); // Output: "gumball/flowers.png"
      Returns:
      The filename of this Tweets's photo

    • getPhotoPixels

      public Color[][] getPhotoPixels()
      Returns the 2D array of Color objects representing the photo pixels.
      Example usage: 
      Tweet tweet = new Tweet("gumball/flowers.png", "Gumball with flowers!", "2024-01-22", 250, 40);
Color[][] pixels = tweet.getPhotoPixels();
      Returns:
      A 2D array of Color objects representing the photo.

    • updatePhoto

      public void updatePhoto(Color[][] pixels)
      Updates the photo with a new set of pixels.
      Example usage: 
      Tweet tweet = new Tweet("gumball/flowers.png", "Gumball with flowers!", "2024-01-22", 250, 40);
Color[][] newPixels = new Color[17][17];
tweet.updatePhoto(newPixels);
      Parameters:
      pixels - The new 2D array of Color objects for the photo

    • getCaption

      public String getCaption()
      Returns the caption of this tweet.
      Example usage: 
      Tweet tweet = new Tweet("gumball/flowers.png", "Gumball with flowers!", "2024-01-22", 250, 40);
System.out.println(tweet.getCaption()); // Output: "Gumball with flowers!"
      Returns:
      The caption of the tweet

    • updateCaption

      public void updateCaption(String caption)
      Updates the caption of this tweet to be the new provided caption.
      Example usage: 
      Tweet tweet = new Tweet("gumball/flowers.png", "Gumball with flowers!", "2024-01-22", 250, 40);
tweet.updateCaption("CSE 122 rocks!");
System.out.println(tweet.getCaption()); // Output: "CSE 122 rocks!"
      Parameters:
      caption - The new caption to set for the tweet.

    • getDate

      public String getDate()
      Returns the date when this tweet was posted.
      Example usage: 
      Tweet tweet = new Tweet("gumball/flowers.png", "Gumball with flowers!", "2024-01-22", 250, 40);
System.out.println(tweet.getDate()); // Output: "2024-01-22"
      Returns:
      The date of the tweet

    • getLikes

      public int getLikes()
      Returns the number of likes for this tweet.
      Example usage: 
      Tweet tweet = new Tweet("gumball/flowers.png", "Gumball with flowers!", "2024-01-22", 250, 40);
System.out.println(tweet.getLikes()); // Output: 250
      Returns:
      The number of likes on the tweet

    • getRetweets

      public int getRetweets()
      Returns the number of retweets on the tweet.
      Example Usage: 
      Tweet tweet = new Tweet("gumball/flowers.png", "Gumball with flowers!", "2024-01-22", 250, 40);
System.out.println("Retweets: " + tweet.getRetweets()); // Output: Retweets: 40
      Returns:
      The number of retweets on the tweet

    • likeTweet

      public void likeTweet()
      Increases the number of likes on this tweet by 1.
      Example Usage: 
      Tweet tweet = new Tweet("gumball/flowers.png", "Gumball with flowers!", "2024-01-22", 250, 40);
tweet.likeTweet();
System.out.println("Likes after liking the tweet: " + tweet.getLikes()); // Output: 251

    • dislikeTweet

      public void dislikeTweet()
      Decreases the number of likes on this tweet by 1.
      Example Usage: 
      Tweet tweet = new Tweet("gumball/flowers.png", "Gumball with flowers!", "2024-01-22", 250, 40);
tweet.dislikeTweet();
System.out.println("Likes after disliking the tweet: " + tweet.getLikes()); // Output: 249

    • retweetTweet

      public void retweetTweet()
      Increases the number of retweets on this tweet by 1.
      Example Usage: 
      Tweet tweet = new Tweet("gumball/flowers.png", "Gumball with flowers!", "2024-01-22", 250, 40);
tweet.retweetTweet();
System.out.println("Retweets after one retweet: " + tweet.getRetweets()); // Output: 41

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Returns a string representation of this tweet, including its photo (represented as colored spaces), caption, number of likes, retweets, and the date.
      Example Usage: 
      Tweet tweet = new Tweet("gumball/flowers.png", "Gumball with flowers!", "2024-01-22", 250, 40);
System.out.println(tweet.toString());
// Output might be:
// 2024-01-22
// Gumball with flowers!
// [Photo representation]
// Likes: 250  |  Retweets: 40
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      The string representation of the tweet

    • equals

      public boolean equals(Object other)
      Compares this tweet with another object to determine if they are equal. Two tweets are considered equal if they have the same photo, caption, date, number of likes, and number of retweets.
      Example Usage: 
      Tweet tweet1 = new Tweet("gumball/flowers.png", "Gumball with flowers!", "2024-01-22", 250, 40);
Tweet tweet2 = new Tweet("gumball/flowers.png", "Gumball with flowers!", "2024-01-22", 250, 40);
System.out.println("Are both tweets equal? " + tweet1.equals(tweet2)); // Output: true if all attributes are identical!
      Overrides:
      equals in class Object
      Parameters:
      other - The object to compare against
      Returns:
      True if the other object is a Tweet with identical photo, caption, date, likes, and retweets
